My niece's wedding in 2022. She said, "I know you love ABBA and I want the DJ to play an ABBA song at the reception.  Which song would you suggest?" I said, "NO DANCING QUEEN!" (because that is always the obvious choice).  I wanted a song that the average casual ABBA listener most likely had never heard of, and one I loved. 'As Good As new' was it!  Also, my niece and her boyfriend had been together for 10 years, so this wedding was to make their relationship 'as good as new.'  During the reception, the music was pretty lame. An hour later, my niece approached us and said, "He has not played your song yet?" I said no. She marched over to the DJ.....and within 5 minutes, the strings we know and love came on.  Everyone stopped. What was this???  Then the strings stopped and the song hit!  I knew people would jump. I dragged my niece (still in her wedding gown!) and my partner to the dance floor and we let it loose.  And the dance floor, which was almost empty until now, was suddenly full.  People loved this!  And it forced the DJ to finally start playing great music to follow.  I have known and loved this song since 1979 and now, every time I hear it, I think of Gabrielle's wedding.

'I Am The City' recorded the 5th May 1982 during sessions for ABBA's 9th album that was never completed, its a really good song very catchy and has hit single potential. 'I Am The City' remained unreleased for 11 years when it was finally included on the 1993 compilation album 'More ABBA Gold', in 2012 the song was included on the Deluxe Edition of 'The Visitors'.

Why Adele's fans are called Daydreamers?

Adele's fans are referred to as "Daydreamers" because of her song "Daydreamer" from her debut album "19." The term has since become a way for her fans to identify themselves and connect with her music. The name reflects the emotional and introspective nature of Adele's songs, which often evoke deep feelings and reflections, akin to the act of daydreaming.

In her song "Daydreamer" she described her first crush on this perfect boy from her childhood. In an open interview she once said that "Daydreamer" is basically her dream man, her ideal perfect man. Although she can never have such a person in her life (as claimed by her), her fans adopted the name "Daydreamers" to commemorate that even though she may not have that perfect man, she will always have us. The fans will become her Daydreamers.
